msDesc.head: A (Ps.-)Roger Bacon, medical works, etc.; B Herbal and medical glossary and synonyma. England, late 14th or early 15th century

supportDesc.extent: ii + 84 (52 + 32) + ii (both sets of endleaves are paper bifolia of the date of the binding)

history.provenance: Two contemporary parts, together early, as shown by the quire numbering and leaf signatures.
John Selden, 1584–1654. Previous shelfmark 'MS. Seld. Arch. B. 19'.

recordHist.source:
Description by Matthew Holford (Jan. 2026). Previously described in the Summary Catalogue (1937)
Summary Catalogue, Vol. 2 Part 1, p. 611 Summary Catalogue, Vol. 2 Part 1, p. 612

altIdentifier.idno: MS. Arch. Selden. B. 35 – Part A

msItem.author: Ps.-Roger Bacon
msItem.title: De retardatione accidentium senectutis
msItem.rubric: Incipit liber quem composuit frater Rogerus Bacon de ordine minorum de retardacione accidentium senectutis & senij ...
msItem.incipit: Domine mundi qui ex nobilissima stirpe

listBibl.bibl: Roger Bacon, De retardatione accidentium senectutis cum aliis opusculis de rebus medicinalibus, ed. A. G. Little and E. Withington (Oxford, 1928), pp. 1-83

msItem.note: On the attribution see Sharpe, Latin Writers, s.n.

msItem.author: Roger Bacon
msItem.title: De uniuersali regimine senum et seniorum
msItem.incipit: Et summa regiminis senum uniuersalis hec est

msItem.author: Roger Bacon
msItem.title: De compositione quarundam medicinarum in speciali quae iuuant sensum

msItem.author: Roger Bacon
msItem.title: De conseruatione iuuentatis
Sermo rei admirabilis siue de retardatione senectutis
Commentary on Roger Bacon, De graduatione medicinarum compositarum, in two parts
msItem.incipit: Expositio capituli de gradibus ut uera congnicio
(fol. 29r) Licet autem superius dicta thorice consideranti
msItem.explicit: quod est faciendum in omnibus consimilibus etc.
msItem.note: Part 2 begins on fol. 29r. Most of fol. 28v is blank. Also in MS. Canon. Misc. 334, with rubric 'exposicio ... predicti tractatus secundum vnum alium magistrum' (ed. cit. p. x).

msItem.author: Roger Bacon
msItem.title: De erroribus medicorum
msItem.rubric: De erroribus medicorum secundum fratrem Rogerum Bacon
msItem.incipit: Vulgus medicorum non cognoscit suam simplicem medicinam

msItem.author: Roger Bacon
msItem.incipit: Frater Rogerus Bacon in libro 6 Scienciarum in 3° gradu sapiencie vbi loquitur de bono corporis

listBibl.bibl: ed. cit., pp. 181-186 (from MS. Bodl. 438 fols. 28r-29r), with discussion at p. xxix: the text is unidentified although it closely resembles passages in other works of Bacon. No rubric in ms.

msItem.author: Roger Bacon
msItem.title: Opus Maius
msItem.rubric: Item alius tractatus eiusdem fratris Rogeri Bacon extractus de sexta parte compendij studij theologie ... est tractatus de materia prius pertractata & extrahitur de capitulo quod intitulatur De sciencia experimentali...
msItem.note: See ed. cit., p. xxix; text ed. Opus maius, ed. J. H. Bridges (Oxford, 1897-1900), ii.204-213 and (first paragraph) Opus Minus, ed. J. S. Brewer, Rolls Series 15 (1859), pp. 373-4.

msItem.author: Serapion the Elder
msItem.title: Breuiarium siue practica medicinae
msItem.rubric: Theorica extracta de libro 7 Serapionis qui est antitodarium suum [in the ink of the text]
msItem.incipit: Necesse est illi qui vult componere medicinas
msItem.explicit: Et quidam dant ex eo ydropicis cum aceto commixto etc.
msItem.note: In 15 chapters, all except the final two headings underlined in red and noted in the margin. The text is attributed to Bacon in MS. Canon. Misc. 480, fols. 38v-47r (see Little in Roger Bacon Essays ... (Oxford, 1914), p. 401.
msItem.colophon: Qui scripsit carmen sit benedictus amen

msItem.incipit: Capiantur vipere cum est finis veris
msItem.note: Fifteenth-century addition in a less formal hand. Part of the chapter on vipers, derived from Avicenna, found in some manuscripts of the Secreta secretorum (ed. Steele, Opera hactenus inedita Rogeri Baconi, V, 106.10-107.30, cf. pp. xxv-xxvi, xlvi).

supportDesc.collation: Too tightly bound to collate fully, but the evidence of catchwords, numbers and signatures suggests 1(8) (fols. 1-8), 2(6) (fols. 9-14), 3(12) (fols. 15-26), 4(10) (fols. 27-36), 5(4) (fols. 37-40), 6(8) (fols. 41-48), 7(4) (fols. 49-52). Catchwords (some in red); quires numbered, 15th century, in leadpoint (?), i-nii (sic), on the opening recto; leaf signatures in leadpoint, 15th century; remains of earlier leaf signatures in which the current first quire was '+', the fourth quire 'a', the sixth quire 'c'.

layoutDesc.layout: 1 col., c. 46-52 lines; frame ruled; ruled space c. 180 c. 110 (fol. 28r: (22 + [177] + 36) × (18 + [108] + 41))

handDesc.summary: Anglicana (cursiva antiquior libraria), with headings in anglicana formata, by three main scribes:
handDesc.handNote: Text on fol. 52r added by a fourth scribe

decoDesc.decoNote: Blue initials of 4 or 3 lines, flourished in red. Paraphs usually alternating red and blue, sometimes red only.
Rubricated, but gaps apparently left for some rubrics (e.g. fol. 24v) not filled in.

history.provenance: Leadpoint notes at the foot of fol. 26v, perhaps relating to the making of the book.
Extensive signs of use, especially towards the beginning; fol. 9r, 'hic incipe', fol. 31r 'usque huc'.

altIdentifier.idno: MS. Arch. Selden. B. 35 – Part B

msItem.title: Synonyma herbarum et medicinarum
msItem.incipit: Absinthium, herba fortis, gallice aloine, anglice Wermode. Respice in centonica & in sandonicum. Abrotanum linerinum, gallice aueroyne, anglice southernewode. Acacia, id est succus desiccatus prunellorum agrestium immaturarum. Item, acacia surra id est dura idem est.

(fol. 55r) Basilicus uel basilica, herba genciana, allogallica, idem virtutem habet calidam & proprie ignitam, gustu amaro, & in locis plaustris nascitur, cuius radix stomachi dolorem compescit & epatis ac splenis siue renum ac cordis, gallice et anglice genciane. Respice tamen in dragentea. Basilicon semen est maiorane, ozimus idem uel ozimum. Bartrorobus ferens mora idem. Bachador, id est ozimum magnum.

(fol. 57r) Calamentum folia habet ad modum origani sed albiora & florem album, gallice calamente, anglice semtositwurt. Calamentum agreste vel siluestre, sisimbrium idem, anglice horsmente vel wildemente. Respice in matercaria aquatica.
msItem.explicit: Sinapis tam semen quam herba est, et quando simpliciter ponitur pro semine intelligitur, inde dicitur sinapismus. Sinape eligenda est non siccum valde quod cum fricatur viride appareat, uirtus est ei calida leptiutica epispactica, apoflegmatismis utile est. Sinaphe phitagoras inter ea que habent uirtutis efficaciam laudat, et primum locum assignat cuius naturam medici uolunt esse termanticam et leptiuticam
msItem.note: Incomplete at end due to loss of leaves. Printed from this manuscript: Alphita, a medico-botanical glossary ..., ed. J. L. G. Mowat, Anecdota Oxoniensia (Oxford, 1887) (ending at p. 172), with variants from the related BL, Sloane MS 284. Mowat dates our manuscript c. 1465 (p. v) for reasons which are not clear.

As Mowat's title suggests, many entries in the synonyma are from the Alphita; the latest edition of that text goes so far as to regard the version found in the present manuscript and in British Library, Sloane MS. 284, as a late and distinct redaction of the gamma family of the Alphita (Alphita, ed. Alejandro García González (Florence, 2007), ms. listed pp. 100-101 (with Mowat's date c. 1465), discussed pp. 116-117, stemma, p. 135)
msItem.bibl: Keiser [247b] lists several collections of synonyma with similar incipits.

supportDesc.collation: 8(8) (fols. 53(a), 53(b), 54-59), 9(8) (fols. 60-7), 10(8) (fols. 68-75), 11(8) (fols. 76(a), 76(b), 77-82). Quires numbered in roman, 15th century, on the bottom centre of the opening recto (niii, niiii, x, xi); leaf signatures in leadpoint, 15th century, in the usual form (using arabic rather than roman), beginning at h1.

layoutDesc.layout: 1 col., c. 43-46 lines; frame-ruled in leadpoint; ruled space c. 175-180 c. 110-115 . (Fol. 75r: (17 + [178] + 45) × (c. 18 + [117] + 31))

handDesc.handNote: Anglicana by one scribe (perhaps scribe 1 of part A)

decoDesc.decoNote: 6-line initial A, fol. 53(a) recto, blue flourished in red. Other initials of 4 lines, blue flourished in red. Alternating red and blue paraphs.
